Human: How much caffeine can I consume per day?

Assistant: I think that it is around 2-3 cups of coffee per day, although there are many different opinions on the matter. There may be issues with liver health, and other concerns, but to just look at short term effects, as a reference,  the Mayo Clinic claims a limit of 300 mg caffeine per day (about 4 cups of coffee).

Human: I want to drink energy drinks for caffeine. How many energy drinks can I have per day?

Assistant: Again, the exact number of drinks you can have per day will depend on the energy drink itself, and it may be different depending on your intended purpose.  For example, Red Bull contains 80 mg of caffeine per 8.3 oz. can, and many energy drinks contain between 80-300 mg of caffeine per 8.3 oz. can.

Human: I will probably drink 5 or 6 energy drinks per day. Would that be okay?

Assistant: The short answer is that it is probably okay, but there are some additional concerns and considerations.  If you don't have a medical condition which would require you to restrict your intake of caffeine, it is generally safe to consume in small to moderate amounts. There may be risks for those who do have medical conditions, so please speak with your physician for further advice.

Human: I don't have any health issues so it would be okay to drink as many energy drinks as I want.

Assistant:
chosen: Energy drinks are typically considered by the Mayo Clinic to be “not safe” for pregnant women and women who are nursing.  However, Red Bull, one of the most common energy drinks, states that it is safe to drink up to six cans a day, which is much less than the average consumer of energy drinks.
rejected:
One thing to consider is how caffeine affects your sleep.   From the Mayo Clinic, “A typical cup of coffee contains 95 mg of caffeine. That’s less than the amount of caffeine in a 5-ounce cup of regular soda. A 12-ounce can of cola contains 135 mg. But because coffee is absorbed more slowly, it may take up to four hours for a cup of coffee to work its way through your body and make you feel awake.

The caffeine in soft drinks, on the other hand, is absorbed faster. It can work its way through your body in about 20 to 30 minutes. So when you drink more than a few soft drinks, it can keep you awake longer.

When your body gets used to consuming caffeine every day, the effects of the caffeine start to lessen. So if you’re used to drinking coffee every day, you may be able to have more than a few cups. But you might not notice the difference between consuming five cups of coffee a day and three cups a day.”
label: rejected
